description.narrative: Governments and other partners in countries affected by the Syria sub-regional crisis are able to reach children and families with humanitarian interventions in line with the CCCs., which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Health And Emergencies, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Nutrition And Emergencies, Nutrition â€“ General, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Polio Eradication, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Supply And Logistics, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Unicef Capacity For Supply And Logistics, Wash And Emergencies, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: GRP1: Governments and regional institutions in MENA benefit from UNICEF technical and other support to achieve sustainable results for children and adolescents in development and humanitarian contexts.
